text: Terra Indigena Xinane Isolados is an indigenous territory in Acre State, Brazil, which has been dedicated to uncontacted Indians. It has a total area of 1,750 km² and contains no contacted human population. It is located on the Bolivian border and is buffered to the north by other reservations, so that in the last few years no people from the outside world have set foot on the TI. ==See also== *Indigenous peoples in Brazil Category:Geography of Acre (state) Category:Uncontacted peoples Category:Indigenous topics of the Amazon Category:Indigenous Territories (Brazil)
title: Xinane Isolados Indigenous Territory
